void ModuleImpl::enableModuleServices (    ) 
 

connect to the broker indicating that this module is now providing services to other modules.

incoming method calls are serviced in seperate threads. Terminates as soon as theis module is connected.

References SystemsBiologyWorkbench::RegisterMode.

void ModuleImpl::run (  int    argc,
char *    argv[],
bool    wait = true
) 
 

Convenience function for performing the tasks required for handling the -sbwdebug, -sbwregister and -sbwmodule options to a module.

This method must be passed the array of command-line arguments passed to the application. This then checks for the presence of -sbwdebug, -sbwregister and -sbwmodule, and acts as follows:

-sbwregister
Runs ModuleImpl.registerModule()
-sbwmodule
Runs ModuleImpl.enableModuleServices()
-sbwdebug
Runs SBWDebug::setTraceMode()
The return behavior of this method depends on whether the optional third argument, wait, is true or false. If true (the default), it waits until SBW is disconnected. If false, it returns immediately. The calling routine should perform whatever tasks it would after enabling module services.

Parameters:
argc  an integer indicate the number of arguments passed to the program on the command line
argv  an array of strings comprising the set of arguments passed to the program on the command line
wait  (optional) boolean argument indicating whether to wait until SBW is disconnected, default value is true.

Definition at line 406 of file ModuleImpl.cpp.
